SELECT pub_id, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT cate_id)
FROM book_mast
GROUP BY pub_id
ORDER BY GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT cate) ASC;

SELECT student.first_name, student.last_name, AVG(mark) avg_mark 
FROM subject
JOIN student on student.ID = subject.stud_id
JOIN marks on marks.id = subject.mark_id
GROUP BY student.first, student.last
HAVING AVG(mar) > 9;

SELECT cate_id,
SUM(receive_qty*purch_price)
FOR purchase
GROUP BY cate_id;

SELECT SUM(mysum)
FROM(
SELECT COUNT(*) :: mysum
FROM book_mast
WHERE no_page>200) AS bb;

SELECT NumProj, TitreProj FROM Projet P
INNER JOIN Realisation R ON P.NumProj=R.NumProj
GROUP BY NumProj TitreProj
HAVING count(*)=(SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Developpeur);
